title: Nancy Hopkins awarded the National Academy of Sciences Public Welfare Medal
desc: The MIT professor emerita and pioneering molecular biologist is being honored for her advocacy for women in science.

title: Susan Solomon wins VinFuture Award for Female Innovators
desc: The award recognizes Solomon’s contributions to understanding ozone depletion and the creation of the Montreal Protocol.

title: MIT Faculty Founder Initiative announces finalists for second competition
desc: Twelve researchers selected as finalists for 2023-24 MIT-Royalty Pharma Prize Competition to support female entrepreneurs in biotech.

title: Inclusive research for social change
desc: The MIT Student Research Program pairs underrepresented students with opportunities to examine inequity through the IDSS Initiative for Combatting Systemic Racism.

title: Everything, everywhere all at once
desc: Cosmologist and MLK Scholar Morgane König uses gravitational waves to study the universe’s origins, inflation, and present trajectory.

title: Gitanjali Rao honored at White House “Girls Leading Change” celebration
desc: First-year MIT student and former Time “Kid of the Year” honored for promoting science and innovation among youth and inspiring them with several inventions.

title: Working to beat the clock on climate change
desc: At the 2023 Clean Energy Education and Empowerment symposium, participants emphasize working together to achieve net zero emissions by 2050.

title: Future Leaders in Aerospace prepares the next generation for research careers
desc: The 2023 symposium offered candid insights and practical advice for aeronautical and astronautical engineers interested in pursuing academia.

title: A new record for Math Prize for Girls wins
desc: Twelfth grader Jessica Wan three-peats, as MIT hosts the 15th competition for female middle and high school math enthusiasts.

title: Opening pathways for future supply chain leaders
desc: Maria Jesus Saenz of the MIT Center for Transportation and Logistics is dedicated to advancing future leaders, and to supporting women, in supply chain management.

title: Professor Emerita Evelyn Fox Keller, influential philosopher and historian of science, dies at 87
desc: The pathbreaking thinker helped reshape discussions of science, gender, and objectivity, as well as biological determinism, in her lauded career.
